channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge in Karen Read Murder Case Declares Mistrial After Jury Deadlocks
item.description: The jurors said they were “deeply divided” over whether Ms. Read killed her boyfriend, a Boston police officer; prosecutors said they would try the case again.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Frees Gazan Hospital Official Whose Detention Prompted Outrage
item.description: Palestinians had decried the detention of the director of Al-Shifa Hospital following an Israeli military raid. His release after seven months drew criticism in Israel.

item.title: How to eat like an Olympian. Inside the world’s largest restaurant feeding over 15,000 athletes and prioritizing plant-based meals over meat
item.description: A sneak peek into four dishes being served at the Paris 2024 Athletes’ Village.

item.title: Biden Campaign Will Try to Reassure Big Donors
item.description: President Biden’s top campaign official is scheduled to hold a crucial call on Monday to convince donors that the president can beat former President Donald J. Trump.

item.title: Chinese Rocket Crashes After Accidentally Launching During Test
item.description: The commercial company Space Pioneer said the accident occurred because of a structural failure in the connection between the rocket and its testing platform.

item.title: Financial markets are pricing in more inflation under another Trump presidency—and bond yields are surging
item.description: The uptick in Treasury yields was led by the longest maturities, with 30-year bonds up more than eight basis points to 4.65%, the highest level since May 31.

item.title: Pay for Lawyers is So High People Are Comparing It to the N.B.A.
item.description: Enormous pay packages are popping up for top lawyers, especially those favored by well-heeled private equity clients.

item.title: Chinese Rocket Accidentally Launches and Crashes During Test
item.description: Videos posted by Chinese news media and on social media appeared to show the rocket climbing before it lost power and plunged, exploding in a nearby hill.

item.title: Bank of America data shows today marks beginning of the S&P 500’s ‘strongest’ average 10-day period of the year…over 96 years
item.description: Bank of America’s strategist Stephen Suttmeier says the S&P 500’s best performing 10 day period has started in July, going back to 1928.

item.title: What Post-Debate Polls Reveal About Replacing Biden
item.description: Which Democratic candidate would stand the best chance of winning a crucial group of voters over?

item.title: The Center Collapses in France, Leaving Macron Marooned
item.description: Squeezed by the far-right National Rally party and the left, President Emmanuel Macron faces a country that may prove ungovernable.

item.title: France’s political chaos has already halted some economic reforms while markets weigh the worst-case scenario
item.description: “We are likely moving to a scenario of political stalemate and paralysis,” said Mohit Kumar, chief economist for Europe at Jefferies International.

item.title: The Trump Decision Reveals Deep Rot in the System
item.description: Instead of delivering a judgment many months ago and allowing the trial to proceed, the justices gave Trump the gift of delay piled upon delay.

item.title: For South Africa’s Cabinet, Bigger May Not Mean Better
item.description: To accommodate a broad and diverse alliance of parties, President Cyril Ramaphosa increased the size of his executive team. Now the challenge is getting a diverse group of politicians to agree.

item.title: Cup Noodles instant ramen adds s’mores flavor—a bid to prove it’s ‘not just a boring thing you’d buy because you’re on a budget’
item.description: The packaged noodle brand is the latest to appeal to Gen Z’s eccentric taste for strange flavor combinations.
